fol.79r
A l
re
to M
r
Bodley & M
r
Gilpin./
After o
r
&c. There is order given by the Officers of the Ordynance in the Tower
to one
William Beale
to make
vic
o
n of a c
r
teine
porc
o
n of matche for her Ma
t
store, who hathe a purpose to
vide the same in some of those
vinces United
. Yo
w
shall therefore in her Ma
t
behalf moove & require suche as represent the
States Gen
r
all
residing there at the
Hague
of the
Councell of estate
(as yo
w
shall thinck most convenie
t
)
to
mitt the said William Beale, or suche as he shall depute, by whome theis o
r
l
re
s
shalbe brought unto yo
w
, to
vide & trannsport hither into this Realme for her Ma
tie
,
suche quantity of matche, or any other needefull
vic
o
n for her Martiall services, as
he or they expresse unto yo
w
. And that they be therein favoured and assisted
aswell for the prises, as for meanes to conveie the same hither into
England
; w
ch
we trust they will not refuse, for that (as we remember) it is by the Contract
accorded that her Ma
tie
may at all tymes uppon occac
o
ns, buy &
vide any suche
kyndes w
th
in the
vinces of the Unyon. Wherein also we require yo
w
to yeld to
the said Beale or his facto
r
yo
r
uttermost aide & furtherance./
